intro: Cracca leucosericea, commonly known as the white silky cracca, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are covered in a fine, silky pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its delicate foliage and airy flowering display.
